reviews.text: The hotel has some charm. Being inside the palace was cool, but also more difficult to find and to get to with luggage- not for handicapped people. The rooms are small, but that was expected. The staff at the restaurant was not friendly or helpful or very fast. It was clean.
reviews.title: overall good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here a night while traveling through Dalmatia. The hotel was right inside the city walls and the architecture was amazing. Our room was very comfortable and you could see the way the hotel was built into the walls of Diocletian's Palace. The staff was friendly, the breakfast was good, and you can't beat the location. Since the Old Town bars cars, you will want to figure out where to park and how to get your luggage to the hotel. However, everyone who is staying inside the city walls has the same difficulties. I would stay here again!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel inside the city walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is conveniently located inside the city wall at the silver gate in the heart of the historical city. We stayed in room 304 which is a good size room with a part of the Diocletians wall inside the room along with a great view of the outside wall! The air conditioning was a plus as it was very hot. The breakfast included made to order eggs along with fruit, juice, bread, etc. and was very good. You can have breakfast inside or outside. We arrived in the early evening and the man at the front desk helped unload our car and also rode with us to show us where to park the car for free. All the front desk people were very helpful and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The hotel also offers free wireless internet. There is no elevator which we did not find to be a problem.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel peristil for 4 nights as part of our trip to croatia.
reviews.title: Great central location

reviews.text: The hotel is inside the palace walls so the location is perfect for seeing the sights. There are great restaurants and bars within easy walking distance.
reviews.title: Peristil Is Perfect!
Eat at their restaurant
reviews.text: I cannot speak for the hotel - although we spoke with other guests who thought it was lovely . However the hotel restaurant - Tiffany - was divine. Have the 'fish in sack' I am not kidding, one of the nicest dinners I have had and paired with lovely local wines. The owner sat outside and chatted with us most of the evening and our lovely waiter was charming. We stumbled upon the restaurant the first night and came back for seconds the following. These are people who really care about the experience they provide and are very concerned that their guests and patrons take away an impression of quality food and ambience.

What a wonderful experience. This hotel was all we expected and more. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the rooms comfortable, the position excellent and the restaurant very high quality. We did have a little trouble finding it but it was worth it!
reviews.title: Atmosphere Plus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's get the few negatives out of the way: I agree with some other reviewers that the rooms are small - not a big deal for us. We want cleanliness and comfort, a bit of style and perhaps a little quirkiness - and we got all that. It is a bit tricky to find - but once you have, there's a sense of achievement and the Peristil becomes your little cosy corner of the city. As for the owners and staff - Daliborka spoiled me rotten...........it was my birthday [49th, since you ask] and there was gift-wrapped honey, and at dinner, a special dessert. Restaurant staff were excellent - efficiency is good, but a warm welcome in addition is lovely.
reviews.title: A credit to Croatia..........

reviews.text: True, there's no lift, and that is a problem for some travellers. Mind you, Croatia is, in general, not easily accessible, with its steep steps, pathways and public buildings, let alone hotels. Having staff who are always on hand to help goes a long way to improving the situation.
reviews.title: very pleasant

likes.disliked: — no clocks in room. I know I was on holiday. But I like a clock. Never thought to bring my own.

reviews.text: There may not be much to draw us back to Split for a return visit, if I'm honest, but for a stopover on our way to an island. We will do that - Hvar this trip, so maybe Brac the next - and we will stay at this great little hotel. Croatian Tourist Board, if you have awards, give them a big one now............
reviews.title: Charmed!

likes.liked: — There is no elevator, but the staff will carry your bags up the stairs. I don't know their pet policy, but dogs accompany their owners at dinner on the patio. I liked that.

reviews.text: The hotel is in an excellent location. You are able to walk to everything including the ferry port. The Hotel staff were warm, friendly and just fabulous and went out of their way to accommodate us. The rooms were charming, small but clean and well appointed. Breakfast was great. We ate at a great restaurant for dinner called Apetit.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Charming, Hotel with Fabulous Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked through a travel agent as we had no idea where to stay in Split. It was a bit more expensive than other places we stayed on our trip and i think we could have paid less if we had booked ourselves and paid cash. (Most places we stayed in europe give a discount for cash)
reviews.title: The lap of luxury

reviews.text: But OHH what a beautiful place. The room was very nice and decorated beautifully. A large size with a nice bathroom too. No, there wasn't an elevator but not many places we stayed in in the 6 weeks we traveled had one.
reviews.title: 2 Nights in Split

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were lovely and tried very hard to make our stay comfortable.
reviews.title: The nigth clerk asked to pay the room rate in cash wo. invoice

reviews.text: Breakfast was great! fresh fruit, expresso coffee, Fruit juice, toast, eggs any way you wish. Yumm!
reviews.title: not bad, not great

reviews.text: This hotel is a real gem. I stayed there for 2 nights in May last year having read the Tripadvisor reviews and thoroughly enjoyed myself. The welcome I got from the owners and staff was really warm - something that you appreciate all the more if you are travelling solo. My room was small but perfectly comfortable and clean - although a bit basic and looked out over a blank wall, hence the marking of average. I arrived at 8am after getting the hydrofoil from Hvar and I was offered breakfast even though I hadn't stayed the night before.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was really good - whilst the room was basic, the food was not. I ended up eating there both nights, having hooked up with 3 American ladies who were great company. There was a good range of food, and the meals I had were really delicious,
reviews.title: Hotel Peristil is THE place in Split

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location - just within the city walls. You can see everything in the old town very easily, and you can get to the bus station and ferry port within 10 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Perfect central location for a Split city stopover, bit noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So, if you are after a comfortable but basic room, with great service and good food, in a fantastic location, then this is the place for you. I wouldn't hesitate to go back.
reviews.title: Exception location in the heart of the historic town of Split

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right inside the old city (Dioclotian's retirement villa). Our room had a wall that dated from the 3rd century. The staff is helpful, professional, and friendly. The hotel is very nicely furnished; it has its own restaurant - breakfast is included.
reviews.title: Perfect Location
